unit14.answer: The Volunteer Coordinator and a supervisor in the assigned area.
options: The Chief of Police.
The volunteer's direct supervisor only.
The Volunteer Coordinator and a supervisor in the assigned area.
The Human Resources department.
unit14.reference: GO 1009.6 ASSIGNMENTS: The use of any volunteer requires the approval of the Volunteer Coordinator and a supervisor in the area where the volunteer will be assigned.

unit14.question: In a death investigation, when can the identity of the deceased be released to the public?
unit14.answer: Only after the next of kin have been notified.
options: Immediately, to assist with the investigation.
Only after the next of kin have been notified.
After 24 hours, automatically.
Never, it is confidential information.
unit14.reference: GO 1010.7 PUBLIC INFORMATION: The identity of the deceased should not be released to the public until the next of kin have been notified.

unit14.question: Who is responsible for the criminal investigation of a suspected arson?
unit14.answer: The Denton Police Department.
options: The Fire Marshal's Office.
The Denton Police Department.
The FBI.
The State Fire Marshal.
unit14.reference: GO 1011.3 ARSON INVESTIGATIONS: The Denton Police Department will conduct the criminal investigation related to any suspected arson.

unit14.question: What is the policy for transporting a juvenile in custody?
unit14.answer: They should not be transported with adult persons in custody.
options: They can be transported with adults if they are handcuffed.
They should not be transported with adult persons in custody.
They must be transported by a juvenile officer.
The policy does not specify.
unit14.reference: GO 1206.6 TRANSPORTING JUVENILES: Juveniles should not be transported with adult persons in custody.

unit14.question: What is the '9-1-1 for Kids' program?
unit14.answer: An educational program to teach children the proper use of the 9-1-1 system.
options: A special phone number for kids to call.
A program to give kids tours of the dispatch center.
An educational program to teach children the proper use of the 9-1-1 system.
A summer camp run by the police department.
unit14.reference: GO 1205.8.1 '9-1-1 FOR KIDS' PROGRAM: The '9-1-1 for Kids' program is an educational program designed to educate children on the proper use of the 9-1-1 emergency telephone system.

unit14.question: Can a person in custody be denied access to make a phone call?
unit14.answer: Yes, if it would jeopardize a legitimate law enforcement interest.
options: No, it is an absolute right.
Yes, if it would jeopardize a legitimate law enforcement interest.
Only if they are being uncooperative.
Only if they have already made one call.
unit14.reference: GO 1201.10 TELEPHONE ACCESS: Telephone access may be denied if it would jeopardize a legitimate law enforcement interest.

unit15.question: What is the Mission Statement of the Denton Police Department?
unit15.answer: To make Denton a safe, sustainable, and livable city for everyone, by keeping victims safe and holding offenders accountable.
options: To enforce all laws and ordinances with unwavering authority.
To be a leader in technological policing and community engagement.
To make Denton a safe, sustainable, and livable city for everyone, by keeping victims safe and holding offenders accountable.
To reduce response times and increase arrest rates annually.
unit15.reference: GO 1500.2 MISSION STATEMENT: The mission of the Denton Police Department is: To make Denton a safe, sustainable, and livable city for everyone, by keeping victims safe and holding offenders accountable.

unit15.question: What is the foundation by which the Denton Police Department serves, according to its Vision Statement?
unit15.answer: The sanctity of human life.
options: The letter of the law.
The sanctity of human life.
The protection of property.
The will of the community.
unit15.reference: GO 1500.3 VISION STATEMENT: The sanctity of human life is the foundation by which the Denton Police Department serves.

unit15.question: What does the 'P' in the department's values acronym P.R.I.D.E. stand for?
unit15.answer: Professionalism.
options: Patience.
Protection.
Professionalism.
Pride.
unit15.reference: GO 1500.4 DEPARTMENT VALUES: The values of the Denton Police Department are: P.R.I.D.E. (a) Professionalism - conducting ourselves in a competent, reliable, and confident manner.

unit15.question: The value of 'Respect' in the P.R.I.D.E. acronym means treating all people with what?
unit15.answer: Dignity, compassion, and without prejudice.
options: Caution and suspicion.
A formal and distant demeanor.
Dignity, compassion, and without prejudice.
The same level of force.
unit15.reference: GO 1500.4(b): Respect - treating all people with dignity, compassion, and without prejudice.

unit15.question: What does the value of 'Integrity' require of department members?
unit15.answer: To be honest and ethical in all actions.
options: To follow all orders without question.
To maintain a clean driving record.
To be honest and ethical in all actions.
To report to work on time.
unit15.reference: GO 1500.4(c): Integrity - being honest and ethical in all our actions.

unit15.question: The value of 'Dedication' means being committed to what?
unit15.answer: The Department's mission and the community we serve.
options: Personal career advancement.
Meeting statistical quotas.
The Department's mission and the community we serve.
Working a minimum number of overtime hours.
unit15.reference: GO 1500.4(d): Dedication - being committed to the Department's mission and the community we serve.

unit15.question: What does 'Excellence,' the final value in P.R.I.D.E., mean?
unit15.answer: Striving for the highest level of performance in all that we do.
options: Never making a mistake.
Being better than other local agencies.
Striving for the highest level of performance in all that we do.
Winning departmental awards.
unit15.reference: GO 1500.4(e): Excellence - striving for the highest level of performance in all that we do.

unit15.question: Which of the following is a stated goal of the Denton Police Department?
unit15.answer: To enforce all laws impartially.
options: To generate revenue for the city.
To ensure all officers live within the city limits.
To enforce all laws impartially.
To have the largest fleet of patrol cars in the county.
unit15.reference: GO 1500.5 GOALS: The goals of the Denton Police Department are to: ... (b) Enforce all laws impartially.

unit15.question: The department is committed to maintaining what kind of standards?
unit15.answer: The highest standards of professionalism and accountability.
options: The minimum standards required by TCOLE.
The standards set by the police union.
The highest standards of professionalism and accountability.
The same standards as the previous year.
unit15.reference: GO 1500.5(d): The goals of the Denton Police Department are to: ... (d) Maintain the highest standards of professionalism and accountability.

unit15.question: What is the purpose of the written directives system?
unit15.answer: To provide members with a source of direction and guidance.
options: To create a basis for civil lawsuits.
To provide members with a source of direction and guidance.
To limit officer discretion in all situations.
To be used for training new recruits only.

options: Informal shift notes.
Verbal orders from supervisors.
Departmental Directives.
Personal officer logs.

unit15.question: How are written directives distributed to department members?

options: Via printed hard copies.
By mail to their home addresses.
Electronically.
Through verbal announcements at briefing.

unit15.question: Who is responsible for reviewing and being familiar with the contents of the General Orders manual?
unit15.answer: Each member of the department.
options: Only supervisors.
The Training Division.
Each member of the department.
The Professional Standards Lieutenant.
unit15.reference: GO 1501.4(a): Each member of the department is responsible for reviewing and being familiar with the contents of this manual.

unit15.question: What is the policy for courtroom attire for uniformed personnel?
unit15.answer: They shall wear the prescribed uniform unless otherwise directed.
options: They can wear business attire.
They shall wear the prescribed uniform unless otherwise directed.
They must wear the Class A dress uniform.
They can choose which uniform to wear.
unit15.reference: GO 1502.3.1 UNIFORMED PERSONNEL: Uniformed personnel shall wear the prescribed uniform when appearing in court, unless otherwise directed by a supervisor.

unit15.question: How should an officer conduct themselves while testifying?
unit15.answer: They shall be truthful and candid at all times.
options: They should provide opinions even when not asked.
They should be argumentative with the defense attorney.
They shall be truthful and candid at all times.
They should avoid making eye contact with the jury.
unit15.reference: GO 1502.4.2 TESTIMONY: Officers shall be truthful and candid at all times when testifying.

unit15.question: Can an officer discuss their testimony with other witnesses?
unit15.answer: No, unless authorized by the prosecutor.
options: Yes, to ensure their stories are consistent.
No, unless authorized by the prosecutor.
Yes, it is encouraged.
Only with witnesses for the defense.
unit15.reference: GO 1502.4.1 PREPARATION: Officers should not discuss their testimony with other witnesses unless authorized to do so by the prosecutor.

unit15.question: What is a required component of the Honor Guard uniform?
unit15.answer: White gloves.
options: A tactical vest.
Combat boots.
White gloves.
A campaign hat.
unit15.reference: GO 1504.5.1 FUNERALS: The Honor Guard uniform consists of the Class A uniform with the addition of white gloves, a ceremonial belt and other authorized equipment.

unit15.question: What is the department's policy on members paying their just debts?
unit15.answer: Members shall pay all their just debts.
options: The department has no policy on personal finances.
Members' debts are their private concern.
Members shall pay all their just debts.
Only debts owed to the city must be paid.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.2 DEBT: Members shall pay all their just debts. A member's failure to do so may be grounds for disciplinary action.

unit15.question: Is a member allowed to use their official position for personal financial gain?
unit15.answer: No, it is prohibited.
options: Yes, with supervisor approval.
No, it is prohibited.
Yes, if the gain is less than $100.
Only if it is related to off-duty employment.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.1 GRATUITIES: Members shall not use their official position or office for personal or financial gain.

unit15.question: What is the policy for consuming alcoholic beverages while on-duty?
unit15.answer: It is strictly prohibited, except for specific undercover assignments.
options: One drink is permissible during a meal break.
It is allowed if the officer is not in uniform.
It is strictly prohibited, except for specific undercover assignments.
It is at the discretion of the on-duty supervisor.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.4 USE OF ALCOHOL: Members shall not consume any alcoholic beverages while on-duty, except in the performance of a specific undercover assignment and with the prior approval of a supervisor.

unit15.question: When is a member prohibited from reporting for duty?
unit15.answer: When they are under the influence of alcohol or any intoxicating substance.
options: If they have had less than 8 hours of sleep.
If they have a minor cold.
When they are under the influence of alcohol or any intoxicating substance.
If they are not in a good mood.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.4(b): A member shall not report for duty or be on duty while under the influence of alcohol or any other intoxicating substance.

unit15.question: Can an officer participate in any political activity while on duty or in uniform?
unit15.answer: No, it is prohibited.
options: Yes, if it is for a local election.
Yes, as long as they are not the candidate.
No, it is prohibited.
Only with the Chief's permission.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.8 BUSINESS AND POLITICAL ACTIVITY: Members shall not participate in any political activity while on-duty or in uniform.

unit15.question: What must a member do if they wish to speak publicly as a representative of the department?
unit15.answer: Obtain prior approval from the Chief of Police or authorized designee.
options: They can speak freely as a representative at any time.
They only need their supervisor's approval.
Obtain prior approval from the Chief of Police or authorized designee.
They must read from a prepared script.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.9 PUBLIC STATEMENTS: Members shall not speak as a representative of the department or on any matter of public concern unless they have obtained prior approval from the Chief of Police or the authorized designee.

unit15.question: What is the duty of a member who becomes aware of a policy violation by another member?
unit15.answer: To promptly report it to a supervisor.
options: To ignore it.
To confront the other member directly.
To promptly report it to a supervisor.
To report it to the police union.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.11 REPORTING VIOLATIONS: Members who become aware of any violation of law or department policy by another member shall promptly report the violation to a supervisor.

unit15.question: If an officer receives a lawful order they disagree with, what should they do?
unit15.answer: Obey the order and then report their objections through the chain of command.
options: Refuse to obey the order.
Obey the order but complain to other officers.
Obey the order and then report their objections through the chain of command.
Secretly record the supervisor giving the order.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.12 INSUBORDINATION: If a member receives an order that they believe is contrary to law or department policy, the member shall obey the order and then promptly report their objections through the chain of command.

unit15.question: What is considered 'Unsatisfactory Performance'?
unit15.answer: A failure to meet the standards of performance established for the member's position.
options: Making a single mistake on a report.
Receiving a citizen complaint.
A failure to meet the standards of performance established for the member's position.
Not volunteering for overtime.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.14 UNSATISFACTORY PERFORMANCE: Unsatisfactory performance is defined as the failure to meet the standards of performance established for the member's position.

unit15.question: Can a member use their official position to endorse a commercial product?
unit15.answer: No, it is prohibited.
options: Yes, if they get paid for it.
No, it is prohibited.
Yes, if the product is related to law enforcement.
Only with the permission of the PIO.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.21 USE OF DEPARTMENT NAME AND PROPERTY: Members shall not use their official position, department name, logo or letterhead to endorse any commercial product or service.

unit15.question: When reporting a work-related injury, what must the employee do?
unit15.answer: Report it to their supervisor as soon as practicable.
options: Wait 24 hours to see if it gets better.
Go to their personal doctor first.
Report it to their supervisor as soon as practicable.
Fill out a report at the end of the week.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.23 WORK-RELATED INJURY AND ILLNESS REPORTING: Any employee who sustains a work-related injury or illness shall report the incident to their supervisor as soon as practicable.

unit15.question: Which of the following is a form of discipline but not considered a formal disciplinary action?
unit15.answer: Counseling.
options: Suspension.
Written reprimand.
Counseling.
Demotion.
unit15.reference: GO 1602.3 FORMS OF DISCIPLINE: (a) Counseling. Counseling is not a formal disciplinary action.

unit15.question: What is the most severe form of disciplinary action?
unit15.answer: Termination.
options: Suspension.
Demotion.
Written reprimand.
Termination.
unit15.reference: GO 1602.3(e): The following forms of discipline may be imposed... (e) Termination.

unit15.question: Can an employee's voluntary disclosure of misconduct be considered a mitigating factor in discipline?
unit15.answer: Yes.
options: No, it has no bearing.
Yes.
No, it is considered an admission of guilt that warrants harsher punishment.
Only if no one else was aware of the misconduct.
unit15.reference: GO 1602.4(a)3.: Mitigating factors may include... (3) The employee's voluntary disclosure of the misconduct.

unit15.question: What is an example of an aggravating factor in a disciplinary case?
unit15.answer: The misconduct was committed while on duty.
options: The employee has a good performance history.
The misconduct resulted in no actual harm.
The misconduct was committed while on duty.
The employee showed remorse.
unit15.reference: GO 1602.4(b)1.: Aggravating factors may include... (1) The misconduct was committed while on duty or in uniform.

unit15.question: What provides the right for a member to appeal a disciplinary suspension?
unit15.answer: Civil Service law.
options: Department policy.
The U.S. Constitution.
Civil Service law.
The City Charter.
unit15.reference: GO 1603.3 APPEAL PROCESS: A member may appeal a disciplinary suspension, demotion or termination in accordance with Civil Service law...

unit15.question: What is the department's policy on retaliation against an employee who reports discrimination?
unit15.answer: Retaliation is strictly prohibited.
options: It is discouraged but not a policy violation.
It is allowed if the initial complaint is unfounded.
Retaliation is strictly prohibited.
It is handled by the city's legal department.
unit15.reference: GO 1301.2 POLICY: The Denton Police Department has a zero-tolerance policy for discrimination, harassment and retaliation...

unit15.question: What is the department's goal regarding public trust?
unit15.answer: To develop and maintain public trust.
options: To assume public trust is automatically granted.
To prioritize officer safety over public trust.
To develop and maintain public trust.
To disregard public trust in favor of efficiency.
unit15.reference: GO 1500.5 GOALS: The goals of the Denton Police Department are to: ... (e) Develop and maintain public trust.

unit15.question: Who must approve a member's request to work outside employment in a security capacity at a bar?
unit15.answer: It is a prohibited form of employment.
options: The on-duty lieutenant.
The Chief of Police.
The Bureau Chief.
It is a prohibited form of employment.
unit15.reference: GO 1505.4 PROHIBITED EMPLOYMENT: Prohibited outside employment includes, but is not limited to: (a) Working in any capacity at a business where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.

unit15.question: A written reprimand will be placed in what file?
unit15.answer: The employee's personnel file.
options: A temporary supervisor's file.
The employee's personnel file.
The department's public complaint file.
A sealed internal affairs file.
unit15.reference: GO 1602.3(b): Written reprimand. A copy of the written reprimand will be placed in the employee's personnel file.

unit15.question: Who is responsible for the final disposition of an appeal of a performance evaluation?
unit15.answer: The Bureau Chief.
options: The appealing employee's direct supervisor.
The Chief of Police.
The Bureau Chief.
The City Manager.
unit15.reference: GO 1400.6 APPEALS: The decision of the Bureau Chief is final.

unit15.question: Is an employee required to identify themselves as a department member on their personal social media profiles?
unit15.answer: No, they are not required to do so.
options: Yes, it is mandatory.
No, they are not required to do so.
Yes, but only if they post about police-related topics.
Only supervisors are required to do so.
unit15.reference: GO 1103.3.3(a): Members are not required to identify themselves as a member of this department on their personal social media profiles.

unit15.question: What is the policy for using department computers to access news websites?
unit15.answer: Incidental and occasional personal use is permitted if it does not interfere with duties.
options: It is strictly prohibited.
It is only allowed for work-related research.
Incidental and occasional personal use is permitted if it does not interfere with duties.
It requires supervisor approval.
unit15.reference: GO 1102.3 PROHIBITED USES: This does not prohibit incidental and occasional personal use of the department's internet access, provided that such use does not interfere with the member's duties, is not for personal financial gain, and does not otherwise violate any department policy.

unit15.question: What should a member do if they are unsure whether a planned public statement is permissible?
unit15.answer: They should consult with a supervisor.
options: Make the statement and see what happens.
Post it on social media instead.
They should consult with a supervisor.
Ask the PIO for advice.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.9 PUBLIC STATEMENTS: Any member who is unsure whether a planned public statement is permissible should consult with their supervisor.

unit15.question: What does the department's philosophy state about the use of force?
unit15.answer: That the primary duty of members is to preserve life.
options: That force is a necessary tool to maintain order.
That the primary duty of members is to preserve life.
That lethal force is justified to protect property.
That force should be used as a first resort.
unit15.reference: Vision Statement: The sanctity of human life is the foundation by which the Denton Police Department serves. The primary duty of its members is to preserve life.

unit15.question: Who is responsible for the maintenance of the written directives system?
unit15.answer: The Professional Standards Lieutenant.
options: The Chief of Police.
The IT Administrator.
The Professional Standards Lieutenant.
Each Bureau Chief.
unit15.reference: GO 1501.4 DISTRIBUTION AND MAINTENANCE: The Professional Standards Lieutenant is responsible for the maintenance of the written directives system.

unit15.question: Is a member allowed to use their position to influence the outcome of a traffic citation for a friend?
unit15.answer: No, it is prohibited.
options: Yes, it is a professional courtesy.
No, it is prohibited.
Only if the friend is also a city employee.
With the approval of the issuing officer's supervisor.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.1 GRATUITIES: Members shall not use their official position or office for personal or financial gain. This includes, but is not limited to, using their position to influence the outcome of any traffic citation, criminal investigation or other matter.

unit15.question: What is the department's policy on members being involved in civil actions?
unit15.answer: They shall not use their official position to assist in a private civil matter.
options: They are encouraged to mediate civil disputes while off-duty.
They can act as a private process server.
They shall not use their official position to assist in a private civil matter.
They are prohibited from being a plaintiff in any lawsuit.
unit15.reference: GO 1601.3.8 BUSINESS AND POLITICAL ACTIVITY: Members shall not use their official position to assist in a private civil matter.
